title: Marketing Analytics Manager, Platforms and Ecosystems Marketing

description:
Sam’s Social Media Club is helping Google find a Marketing Analytics Manager, Platforms and Ecosystems Marketing.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: New York, NY, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA.

Minimum qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field, business field, or equivalent practical experience.
• 3 years of experience working in analytical roles in marketing, data science, or financial services.
• Experience with using data and analytics, SQL, R, or similar statistical programming languages to make decisions.

Preferred qualifications:
• 3 years of experience in marketing analytics with design experiments, developing statistical models, measuring campaigns, and identifying optimization opportunities, or using data and analytics in technology or financial services.
• Experience in performing analytics on mobile applications or app marketplaces.
• Experience in processing and analyzing data from datasets.
• Experience with cross-functional stakeholder management.
• Knowledge of performance marketing or partner marketing.
• Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment supporting multiple products/teams concurrently.

About the job

At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google’s products solve problems.

In this role, you will manage analytics of various marketing programs for products within Google Platforms and Ecosystems. You will develop methodologies to understand the impact from engagement marketing, direct response, and strategic programs within marketing. You will also identify the right metrics for success and develop measurement techniques to make investment recommendations. You will work with various internal stakeholders to support development of new programs that will improve customer engagement and business growth. This is an opportunity to guide impactful decisions that will improve the experience of users globally.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $105,000-$154,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

Responsibilities
• Manage marketing analytics for products like Google Play or Google Chrome. Establish metrics and measurement plans that explain the incremental impact of marketing campaigns.
• Translate business questions into appropriate analytical projects that will inform strategic and tactical business decisions. Conduct end-to-end analysis autonomously and communicate insights.
• Drive analytic insights and recommendations in structured and unstructured data environments, working with data sets or developing decision making frameworks in situations with limited data.
• Partner cross-functionally with a wide variety of teams and stakeholders including product marketing managers, analysts, and engineers to execute high impact initiatives.
• Identify and communicate insights to senior management and cross-functional stakeholders for better decision making.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications that you choose to submit are subject to Google’s applicant and candidate privacy policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the users we serve, creating a culture of belonging and providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, creed, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), expecting or parents-to-be, criminal histories consistent with legal requirements or any other basis protected by law. See also Google’s EEO Policy, Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal, Belonging at Google and How we hire.

If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles unless stated otherwise in the job posting.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency CVs. Please do not forward CVs to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organisation location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs.
